page.title: 11Pubs in Dargate and Blean
page.content: Of the three public houses shown on the map, the one at Denstroude is now a dwelling house. The two remaining are very different in character. The Dove at Dargate changed hands in recent years. It was a typical local rural pub but has now developed s much wider clientel, which is suprising considering its relatively isolated position. As well as its function as a village local, food is served both at lunchtime and in the evening. The regulars represent the pub in village activities entering several teams in the Hernhill Village Hall Annual quiz in 1984. Morris men are regular visitors and perform their dances in the road in front of the Dove. The Tickham Hunt and the Blean Beagles meet here occasionally during the year.
